thoughts.text: It seems that the 'kill' command did not terminate the 'river_simulation.py' script because the process ID returned by the 'pgrep' command earlier was not correct. I will use the 'ps' command to list all running processes and manually locate the process ID for the 'river_simulation.py' script.
thoughts.reasoning: The process ID returned by the 'pgrep' command earlier was not correct, which is why the 'kill' command did not work. Using the 'ps' command to manually locate the process ID for the 'river_simulation.py' script will help us terminate it.
thoughts.plan:
- Use 'ps' command to list all running processes
- Manually locate the process ID for the 'river_simulation.py' script
- Use 'kill' command to terminate the script
thoughts.criticism: I should have double-checked the process ID returned by the 'pgrep' command earlier before using the 'kill' command to terminate the 'river_simulation.py' script.
